Posts.Content: What a stupid remark for you GP to make !!!!! Well that's it then if we could all stop worrying we would not be in the 4am club would we. Just read what GP had told you and felt so angry and protective of you. You take care xx
Posts.Title: 4 am club !!!

Posts.Content: Good morning thought Christmas would fool body and I would miss 4am club x that was so wishful thinking. Got 7people tomorrow for dinner and drinks. Boys are going to football match feel this is going to be a busy boozy day too can catch up over weekend. Hope all of you had great Christmas day, what was Eastenders like I am still recovering from all the stress in the Carter household. Xx
Posts.Title: 4am club

Posts.Content: Great news mistymoley. Many many more - enjoy x Denise
Posts.Title: 4 years on

Posts.Content: I totally agree it is absolutely disgusting. The comments from Dreamthief about more provision for elderly patients would ease bed blocking and would help the impact on A and E. I have worked in the NHS for 25 years and seen many changes and agree also that throwing more money at it is not the answer. Bank staff cost twice as much as our permanent staff and I spend half my time sorting out the problems they cause because they are not as answerable for their actions. I wonder if Mr Cameron would take this action if one of his loved ones had breast cancer and it gave them longer to live.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer drugs stopped by Mr Cameron

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy like you I was diagnosed in March this year and I am still very tearful over little things. Over Christmas negative thoughts do keep coming into my mind it is the last thing I think of at night , all through the night and then first thing in the morning - What is that pain ? Will it come back ? I do know I can do nothing about it that I hate because it is out of my control. I have decided that it has changed my life for ever but I will not allow it to cloud every day I am trying so hard to make the cancer experience not spoil my life - but it is very hard I do understand. Sending you a hug and a very positive healthy happy New year. X
Posts.Title: Finding the uncertainty unbearable at times

Posts.Content: \Hi Valerie I am absolutely delighted, I was thinking of you earlier.  Have a great Christmas. Denise x
Posts.Title: Yeeeaaaah - Yippeee Christmas Came Early!

Posts.Content: I was started on anastroloze in July 2014 I have tried various brands but SE have been so dreadful. I have immune and osteoarthritis quite wide spread anyway but was getting so I could not manage stairs or move about very well because of the pain. I was seriously thinking of having to stop working added to this I was not sleeping. A locum GP took pity on me 2 days before Christmas and prescribed Arimidex for one month, the difference after 7 days was amazing I was much mobile pain reduced and sleeping for 4 hours at a time. I asked for a repeat prescription of Arimidex but my GP said I have to have Anastroloze. I am so upset I cannot take Anastroloze because I fear I will end up in a wheelchair because of reduced mobility. She said it is no different just alot mire expensive I offered to pay for it and she quoted something in the region of £1000 each prescription. I really do not know what to do my tumour was ER7 and PR8 which I am told is high. Has anyone got any advice please I feel so tearful over this decision.
Posts.Title: GP will not give me Arimidex on Nhs

Posts.Content: Thank you all that is great so much information - just what I needed. I started originally on Tamoxifen but was all ill taken off it after two weeks. It caused breathlessness nausea sickness - every cloud though I did lose half a stone. I will take this email traill with me as GP said I am the only person this has happened to !!! Then will give oncologist a call. X
Posts.Title: GP will not give me Arimidex on Nhs

Posts.Content: That is absolutely ridiculous please ask to speak to the clinical site manager tonight, they are on duty 24 /7 you need someone to prescribe antibiotics or take appropriate action now not Monday. Good luck keep us posted Denise x
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and severe swelling

Posts.Content: Thank you so much MistyMoley I do put on a brave face instead of showing how bad I really am. X
Posts.Title: GP will not give me Arimidex on Nhs

Posts.Content: Hi everyone have only been on anastroloze for 16 days and like you all pain in feet hands and joints so bad. Cannot sleep either I don't feel I can moan to anyone as I did not need to have chemotherapy and feel I am being six a wimp. Husband and I sleep in separate rooms because I have worst night sweats and why should I keep him awake as well I feel such a nuisance since I got diagnosed in April.  Hair is coming out in handfuls too I cannot believe one small  tablet can cause us all such misery. I could not tolerate tamoxifen at all. I do not feel alone with all this though since joining this site thank you all for listening and making me feel better. X
Posts.Title: Can't sleep

Posts.Content: Thank you both, I read the link you looked up for me MM really appreciate your help. X
Posts.Title: Red Bush Tea

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with invasive hormone receptive cancer April 2014 and have been really struggling with the side effects of Arimidex but discovered Red Bush Tea a few weeks ago. I am sleeping better my arthritis is bearable most days and hot flushes down by 50% but today I read not to drink red Bush Tea if you have hormone receptive breast cancer.  Anyone got any knowledge of this I am so upset as for the first time in 18 months I feel little bit normal.
Posts.Title: Red Bush Tea

Posts.Content: Oh this sounds really interesting. One of the dieticians I work with has a very strong family history of breast cancer. She is in her 30s and told me as the medical profession aren't very helpful in monitoring her,a few years ago she researched on this theory herself and is absolutely convinced to stay breast cancer free is to avoid dairy at all costs. Denise
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hello I had WLE April 2014 followed by 15 sessions of radiotherapy, I have been on Arimidex since August 2014 and ever since surgery developed a slight swelling over my ribs on operation side.  Over time this has become quite large, painful and tender if you press lightly on any of my ribs.  I recently had a CT scan and it has been diagnosed as lymphodema of my rib cage on the left side.  I was very worried as I was convinced it was mets in my ribs.  I do have wide spread arthritis and take two types of painkillers for that, so do have lots of pain and stiffness everywhere really.  I hope this makes you feel not quite so worried.  Denise x
Posts.Title: Pain down side of ribs

Posts.Content: Good morning lovelies Happy Christmas Eve x my tea fairy is on the ball this morning had tea already. Been awake most of night meant to make it and then fell asleep !! Have good day. X
Posts.Title: happy xmas eve lovely ladies !!!

Posts.Content: Such positive thoughts am really going to try because I know all what you are saying is so true. I have had pain in my rib and shoulder blade I cannot control with my arthritis drugs and just before Christmas cannot face the uncertain future of more tests and scans. So in my head thought exactly what you have all written - let's all live for today and make some wonderful memories. X
Posts.Title: I've Just Had A Brainwave!

Posts.Content: Hi Lilly I could not take tamoxifen and was put on Anastroloze I had been on it since August this year and have put on 10lb I am 57 and have never had a weight problem before. I am struggling with the side effects apart from the weight gain which it worrying when you consider I have not been on it very long. Lots luck with your decision but everyone is so different. X
Posts.Title: Not sure what to do can anyone help

Posts.Content: I had my operation April 2014 and I am still blue !! X
Posts.Title: blue boobs

Posts.Content: I have only ever had root canal work on a tooth approximatelya year before diagnosis. I went to a breast cancer bra fitting evening about a month ago and could find no common denominator - makes you wonder !!! Wish I would have asked the ladies there just to see per centage.
Posts.Title: Root canal and cancer

Posts.Content: I have been on Anastroloze just over three months had all other side effects insomnia,sweats,pain feet,hands,knees since taking it, last week have now got hip pain constanly. I take lots of pain relief for widespread arthritis, not in hips though. Had scans for secondaries in July which were clear. Wondered if anyone else has experienced hip pain ? I am just concerned they have just started now. I us we d to be sensible and logical before breast cancer - honest !!!
Posts.Title: Hip pain Anastroloze ??

Posts.Content: Hi all of you lovelies coming back to me with your replies. To answer some questions I had MRI back bone scan with dye full body and dexa for bone density but at that time had no hip pain. Cannot take tamoxifen got dreadful side effects only on it for two weeks changed to anastroloze which give me sweats insomnia joint pain weight gain itchy random rashes !! And now I am hoping hip pain as well. Thank you all so much for responding means alot. Xx
Posts.Title: Hip pain Anastroloze ??

Posts.Content: How good is that. I felt like that when I could put my hand over my head and I cried too. 2016 here we come !!! X
Posts.Title: Small success!

Posts.Content: Hi Judith - what a day you had yesterday poor you. CBT session did not seem to go too badly considering it was your first and you had to cut it short because of problems you had sorting out your lost cards. Glad you are going back I do hope it helps. Not sleeping does not help does it I do think if I could sleep properly and not been in constant pain I would be able to cope with everything better.  Do you live in Brighton and commute to London ? I was moaning the other day because it took me 40 minutes to drive home from work !!!  I am going to watch dog programme on catch up still miss mine several years without him. Would not be fair to have a dog working full time like you like up 6 flights. Having your flat flooded sounds no joke - what are they up to above you ?? Hope today is better you take care x
Posts.Title: feeling sad and angry after having had breast cancer

Posts.Content: Have been reading all replies on this thread. Can really relate to everything that has been said thought I was going mad. Insomnia with the anastroloze and pain not forgetting the weight gain does not help the situation either. I am sure CBT sessions will be good for you jmp keep us posted. Hugs to everyone x
Posts.Title: feeling sad and angry after having had breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne I have exactly the same problem started about week or so ago. I had WLE and sentinel node removal, 15 rads and on anastroloze. I am quite concerned but have done nothing as I am due to see surgeon on Friday.  Will keep you posted as to what he says. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Do you think this is normal ?

Posts.Content: Wishing you both a speedy recovery you have been missed greatly. Take care xx
Posts.Title: G n j
